documents.document: "What a wonderful life I've had! I only wish I'd realized it sooner." - Collette
Franklin D. Roosevelt advised, "When you get to the end of your rope, tie a knot and hang on."
Don't drink and drive, its a bad mix ;-) -- police department
Spencer Johnson said, "Happiness is not having what you want, it's wanting what you have."
"Nobody can go back and start a new beginning, but anyone can start today and make a new ending. -Maria Robinson
"Nobody can go back and start a new beginning, but anyone can start today and make a new ending. -Maria Robinson
"People want economy and they will pay any price to get it." - Lee Iacocca
Winston Churchill said, "It is no use saying, 'We are doing our best.' You have got to succeed in doing what is necessary."
"Do something for somebody every day for which you do not get paid." - Albert Schweitzer
"Live as if you were living a second time, and as though you had acted wrongly the first time." - Viktor Frankl
Mikhail Gorbachev said, "Sometimes when you stand face to face with someone, you cannot see his face."
"I wish I could stand on a busy street corner, hat in hand, and beg people to throw me all their wasted hours." - Bernard Berenson
A man only learns in two ways, one by reading, and the other by association with smarter people. - Will Rogers
"The income tax has made more liars out of the American people than golf has." - Will Rogers
Only enemies speak the truth; friends and lovers lie endlessly, caught in the web of duty. - Stephen King
Harry Millner said, "There are many paths to the top of the mountain but only one view."
Ben Sweetland said, "We cannot hold a torch to light another's path without brightening our own."
"A bank is a place where they lend U an umbrella in fair weather & ask for it back when it begins to rain." - Robert Frost
"Knowing is not enough, we must apply. Willing is not enough, we must do." - Johann von Goethe
Success consists of getting up once oftener then you fall down.
"When I was young, I used to admire intelligent people; as I grow older, I admire kind people." - Abraham Joshua Heschel
Credit for teamwork eventually goes to an individual. Sometimes you want the credit, and sometimes you don't
You can't control the wind, but you can adjust the sail.
"Many a man fails to become a thinker for the sole reason that his memory is too good." - Friedrich Nietzsche
"The past is never dead - it is not even past." - William Faulkner
"2 things 2 aim in life; 1st 2 get what u want, & after that 2 enjoy it. Only d wisest of mankind achieve d 2nd." - Logan Pearsall Smith
"Age is a very high price to pay for maturity." - Tom Stoppard
"Home is the place where, when you have to go there, they have to take you in." - Robert Frost
Martin Luther King Jr. said, "A man who won't die for something is not fit to live."
"The way to get things done is not to mind who gets the credit of doing them." - Benjamin Jowett
"If you are able to state a problem, it can be solved." - Edwin H. Land
Experience is the name everyone gives to their mistakes. - Oscar Wilde
"In three words I can sum up everything I've learned about life: It goes on." - Robert Frost
"Any activity becomes creative when the doer cares about doing it right, or doing it better." John Updike said that.
"A fanatic is one who can't change his mind and won't change the subject." - Sir Winston Churchill
The old believe everything; the middle-aged suspect everything; the young know everything. - Oscar Wilde
"Experience is a good teacher, but she sends in terrific bills." - Minna Antrim
an anonymous wag said, "Bad habits are like a comfortable bed, easy to get into but hard to get out of."
"Even if you're on the right track, you'll get run over if you just sit there." - Will Rogers
H. Jackson Brown Jr. said, "Our character is what we do when we think no one is looking."
"If a friend is in trouble, don't annoy him by asking if there is anything you can do. Think up something appropriate and do it." - Edga ...
"Give light and the people will find their own way." - Scripps-Howard newspapers
"I am an idealist. I don't know where I am going, but I am on my way." - Carl Sandburg
"Patience is bitter, but its fruit is sweet." - Aristotle
Confucius said: "I hear and I forget. I see and I remember. I do and I understand."
Richard L. Evans said, "Don't let life discourage you; everyone who got where he is had to begin where he was."
"Good people are good because they've come to wisdom through failure." - William Saroyan
Edward W. Howe said, "If you don't learn to laugh at troubles, you won't have anything to laugh at when you grow old."
"The secret of joy in work is contained in one word - excellence. To know how to do something well is to enjoy it." - Pearl Buck
"Drop the question what tomorrow may bring, and count as profit every day that Fate allows you." - Horace
Martha Grimes said, "We don't know who we are until we see what we can do."
It was Jerry Seinfeld who said, "A bookstore is one of the only pieces of evidence we have that people are still thinking."
there's a Chinese proverb that says, "If you are patient in one moment of anger, you will escape a hundred days of sorrow."
"I think there is only one quality worse than hardness of heart and that is softness of head." - Theodore Roosevelt
Mahatma Gandhi said, "You must be the change you wish to see in the world."
"The years teach much which the days never knew." - Ralph Waldo Emerson
"When you have a number of disagreeable duties to perform, always do the most disagreeable first." - Josiah Quincy
"Facts are facts and will not disappear on account of your likes." - Jawaharlal Nehru
"Now that it's all over, what did you really do yesterday that's worth mentioning?" - Coleman Cox
"You grow up the day you have your first real laugh at yourself." - Ethel Barrymore
"Until you make peace with who you are, you'll never be content with what you have." - Doris Mortman
"No matter what you have done to this moment, you get 24 brand new hours to spend every single day." - Brian Tracy
"Always be a little kinder than necessary." - James M. Barrie #Quotes #Quote
"Knowledge is of two kinds: we know a subject ourselves, or we know where we can find information upon it." - Samuel Johnson
Mark Twain remarked, "I never let schooling interfere with my education."
Anatole France said, "To imagine is everything, to know is nothing at all."
"Charity and personal force are the only investments that are worth anything." - Walt Whitman
"Stop leaving and you will arrive. Stop searching and you will see. Stop running away and you will be found." - Lao Tzu
Vladimir Lenin said, "A lie told often enough becomes truth."
"If you hate a person, you hate something in him that is part of yourself. What isn't part of ourselves doesn't disturb us." - Herman Hesse
"Nobody really cares if you're miserable, so you might as well be happy." Cynthia Nelms said that.
Michel de Montaigne said, "There is no conversation more boring than the one where everybody agrees."
"It is better to fail in originality than to succeed in imitation." - Herman Melville
"The reason people blame things on previous generations is that there's only one other choice." - Doug Larson
"No man really becomes a fool until he stops asking questions." - Charles Steinmetz
"Always and never are two words you should always remember never to use." - Wendell Johnson
"The only normal people are the ones you don't know very well." - Joe Ancis
"When we remember we are all mad, the mysteries disappear and life stands explained." - Mark Twain
"The strongest of all warriors are these two -- Time and Patience." - Leo Tolstoy
"The tragedy of life is not that it ends so soon, but that we wait so long to begin it." - Anon.
"Men are born with two eyes, but only one tongue, in order that they should see twice as much as they say." - Charles Caleb Colton
"Common sense is instinct. Enough of it is genius." - George Bernard Shaw
"I am extraordinarily patient provided I get my own way in the end." - Margaret Thatcher
"Believe those who are seeking the truth. Doubt those who find it." - Andre Gide
"If winning isn't everything, why do they keep score?" - Vince Lombardi
"Good judgement comes from experience. Experience comes from bad judgement." - Jim Horning
"Discovery consists of seeing what everybody has seen and thinking what nobody has thought." - Alert von Szent-Gyorgyi
"Be civil to all; sociable to many; familiar with few; friend to one; enemy to none." - Benjamin Franklin
"Madness is to think of too many things in succession too fast, or of one thing too exclusively." - Voltaire
"It wasn't until late in life that I discovered how easy it is to say 'I don't know'." - W. Somerset Maugham
Ralph Waldo Emerson wrote, "Good men must not obey the laws too well."
"The mind is its own place, and in itself / Can make a heaven of hell, a hell of heaven." - John Milton
"You can get help from teachers, but you are going to have to learn a lot by yourself, sitting alone in a room." - Dr. Seuss
"The eyes of others our prisons; their thoughts our cages." - Virginia Woolf
U.S. President Calvin Coolidge reportedly said, "If you don't say anything, you won't be called upon to repeat it."
"Happiness is good health and a bad memory. " - Ingrid Bergman
"Everything has been figured out, except how to live." - Jean-Paul Sartre
"Minds are like parachutes; they work best when open." - Lord Thomas Dewar
"I do not know the key to success but the key to failure is trying to please everyone." - Bill Cosby
"Rather to fail with honor than to succeed with fraud." - Sophocles
